intro: Satureja grandibracteata, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and alpine environments, often at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, with a scent reminiscent of thyme and oregano. Satureja grandibracteata produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer.
